description: Select to prevent user from overriding existing data.

Payroll_Payee_W-4Object.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

Payroll_Payee_W-4ObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

Specifies if Multiple Jobs or Spouse Works is selected for Federal.
Specifies if Total Dependent Amount is selected for Federal.
Specifies if Other Income is selected for Federal.
Specifies if Deductions is selected for Federal.
Nonresident Alien Indicator on the W-4
New attribute, Exempt from NRA Additional Amount, added in W19. If worker is a Nonresident Alien, use this attribute to indicate whether the worker is subject to NRA Additional Amount.

description: Element to hold all of the Data to Put or Get for a W-4

validation.validation: Exempt from NRA Additional Amount may only be True if Nonresident Alien is also True.
Assign the worker to a pay group before adding tax elections.
The Company specified is not valid for the Worker.
Clear the value from the Multiple Jobs or Spouse Works field, or change the effective date to after or on 2020-01-01.
Clear the value from the Deductions field, or change the effective date to after or on 2020-01-01.
Clear the value from the Number of Allowances field, or change the effective date to prior to or on 2019-12-31.
Enter a Marital Status that’s valid for the Payroll Tax Authority and the effective date.
Clear the value from the Other Income field, or change the effective date to after or on 2020-01-01.
Clear the value from the Total Dependent Amount field, or change the effective date to after or on 2020-01-01.
An Exempt selection and a Nonresident Alien selection is not allowed.
